      Copies the input vector (vin) to the output vector (vout).
      Parameters:
      vin - The input vector to be copied to the output vector vout.
      vout - The output vector which contains vin on exit.

    • negate

      public static void negate(double[] v0)
      Changes the direction of the input vector by reversing the sign of all three components.
      Parameters:
      v0 - the vector whose sign will be reversed.

    • increment

      public static void increment(double[] rslt, double[] v0)
      Increment the result vector by the contents of v0.
      Parameters:
      rslt - On exits contains rslt = rslt + v0;
      v0 - The point added to rslt.

    • decrement

      public static void decrement(double[] rslt, double[] v0)
      Decrement the result vector by the contents of v0.
      Parameters:
      rslt - On exits contains rslt = rslt - v0;
      v0 - The point subtracted from rslt.

    • addMult

      public static double[] addMult(double m0, double[] v0, double m1)
      Performs the operation m0 * v0 + m1 and returns the result as a double[]. Here m0 and m1 are scalars and v0 is a vector.
      Parameters:
      m0 - The scale factor used to scale v0.
      v0 - The vector to be scaled by m0.
      m1 - The additive increment summed to the returned result.
      Returns:
      double[]

      Parameters:
      rslt - = m0 * v0 + m1.
      m0 - The scale factor used to scale v0.
      v0 - The vector to be scaled by m0.

      Parameters:
      rslt - = m0 * v0 + v1.
      m0 - The scale factor used to scale v0.
      v0 - The vector to be scaled by m0.
      v1 - The additive vector summed to rslt.

    • addMult

      public static double[] addMult(double m0, double[] v0, double m1, double[] v1)
      Performs the operation m0 * v0 + m1 * v1 and returns the result as a double[]. Here m0 and m1 are scalars and v0 and v1 are vectors.
      Parameters:
      m0 - The scale factor used to scale v0.
      v0 - The vector to be scaled by m0.
      m1 - The scale factor used to scale v1.
      v1 - The vector to be scaled by m1.
      Returns:
      double[]

    • addMult

      public static void addMult(double[] rslt, double m0, double[] v0, double m1, double[] v1)
      Performs the operation rslt = m0 * v0 + m1 * v1. ere m0 and m1 are scalars and v0, v1, and rslt are vectors.
      Parameters:
      rslt - = m0 * v0 + m1 * v1.
      m0 - The scale factor used to scale v0.
      v0 - The vector to be scaled by m0.
      m1 - The scale factor used to scale v1.
      v1 - The vector to be scaled by m1.

    • midPoint

      public static double[] midPoint(double[] v0, double[] v1)
      Calculates the midpoint of the two input vectors, v0 and v1, and returns the result as a double[]. Returns (v0 + v1) / 2.
      Parameters:
      v0 - An end-point of the line containing the midpoint.
      v1 - An end-point of the line containing the midpoint.
      Returns:
      double[]

    • midPoint

      public static void midPoint(double[] rslt, double[] v0, double[] v1)
      Calculates the midpoint of the two input vectors, v0 and v1, and returns the result in rslt.
      Parameters:
      rslt - = (v0 + v1) / 2.
      v0 - An end-point of the line containing the midpoint.
      v1 - An end-point of the line containing the midpoint.

    • distance3D

      public static double distance3D(double[] v1, double[] v2)
      Returns the straight-line distance in vector units from v1 to v2.
      Parameters:
      v1 - The point from which the distance to v2 will be returned.
      v2 - The point to which the distance from v1 will be returned.
      Returns:
      double straight-line distance from v1 to v2 in degrees.

    • distance3DSquared

      public static double distance3DSquared(double[] v1, double[] v2)
      Returns the straight-line distance squared in vector units from v1 to v2.
      Parameters:
      v1 - The point from which the squared distance to v2 will be returned.
      v2 - The point to which the squared distance from v1 will be returned.
      Returns:
      double straight-line distance squared from v1 to v2 in degrees.

      public static double length(double[] u)
      Find the length of a 3-element vector.
      Parameters:
      u - double[]
      Returns:
      the length of the vector. Guaranteed to be >= 0.

    • lengthSquared

      public static double lengthSquared(double[] u)
      Find the squared length of a 3-element vector.
      Parameters:
      u - double[]
      Returns:
      The squared length of the vector.

    • interpolate

      public static void interpolate(double[] v0, double[] v1, double f, double[] rslt)
      Interpolates a point on the line between v0 and v1 and places the result in rslt.
      Parameters:
      v0 - Beginning point on line.
      v1 - Ending point on line
      f - Fractional distance between v0 (f=0) and v1 (f=1).
      rslt - Result of interpolation (rslt = (v1 - v0) * f + v0).

    • interpolate

      public static void interpolate(double[] v0, double[] v1, double[] v2, double s, double t, double[] rslt)
      Interpolates a position in the triangle defined by points v0, v1, and v2. The result in placed in rslt for return. The position is defined by the two fractions s and t where s + t < 1 (if the result is to lie within the triangle bounds).
      Parameters:
      v0 - First triangle point.
      v1 - Second triangle point.
      v2 - Third triangle point.
      s - Fractional distance from v0 to v2.
      t - Fractional distance from v0 to v1.
      rslt - Result of interpolation where (rslt = (v2 - v0) * s + (v1 - v0) * t + v0).

    • equals

      public static boolean equals(double[] v0, double[] v1)
      Returns true if v0 and v1 have identical components.
      Parameters:
      v0 - Vector to be tested with v1 for equality.
      v1 - Vector to be tested with v0 for equality.
      Returns:
      true if v0 and v1 have identical components.

    • scalarTripleProduct

      public static double scalarTripleProduct(double[] v0, double[] v1, double[] v2, double[] vp)
      Calculate the scalar triple product (vp-v0) dot ((v2-v0) x (v1-v0)).
      Parameters:
      v0 - Base point of local coordinate system.
      v1 - First point of plane in local system as v1-v0.
      v2 - Second point of plane in local system as v2-v0.
      vp - Point to be dotted in local system (relative to v0).
      Returns:
      double Scalar triple product (vp-v0) dot ((v2-v0) x (v1-v0))

    • vectorTripleProduct

      public static boolean vectorTripleProduct(double[] v0, double[] v1, double[] v2, double[] rslt)
      Compute the normalized vector triple product ((v1-v0) x (v2-v0)) x (v1-v0) and store the result in rslt.
      Parameters:
      v0 - Base point of local coordinate system.
      v1 - First point defined in local system as v1-v0.
      v2 - Second point defined in local system as v2-v0.
      rslt - = ((v1-v0) x (v2-v0)) x (v1-v0)
      Returns:
      true if rslt has finite length, false if length(rslt) is zero.

    • dot

      public static double dot(double[] v0, double[] v1, double[] v2)
      Dot product of v1 and v2 in the v0 local space (v1-v0)dot(v2-v0).
      Parameters:
      v0 - Origen in local space.
      v1 - First point to be dotted with v2 in v0 local space.
      v2 - Second point to be dotted with v1 in v0 local space.
      Returns:
      dot product = (v1-v0)dot(v2-v0).

    • cross

      public static void cross(double[] v0, double[] v1, double[] v2, double[] rslt)
      Cross product of v1 with v2 in the v0 local space (v1-v0)x(v2-v0).
      Parameters:
      v0 - Origen in local space. Result is not normalized.
      v1 - First point to be crossed with v2 in v0 local space.
      v2 - Second point to be crossed with v1 in v0 local space.
      rslt - cross product = (v1-v0)x(v2-v0).

    • move

      public static void move(double[] w, double[] vtp, double x, double y, double[] u)
      Move unit vector w in direction of vtp by distance y. Then rotate the result by angle x around vtp. Normalize result and return in u.
      Parameters:
      w - double[]
      vtp - double[]
      x - double
      y - double
      u - double[]
